pullrequest.title: Windows: compile tests and examples (take II)

content.raw: This is interesting. Indeed the c++11 does not have variable length arrays (vector should be that kind of structure) and it is working at all due to a [gcc extension](https://gcc.gnu.org/onlinedocs/gcc/Variable-Length.html). I've used the c++11 constexpr in 54ae77f to workaround the problem, so the member is known at compile time and should make the compiler to be happy. code_check on trusty is clean and [drone.io](https://drone.io/bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-transport/211) is happy. I'm happy too.
